text: <!channel>:  We've got the big 390 conference room for our UX hangout
<http://invis.io/3X2ARHDBC|invis.io/3X2ARHDBC>
thunder1
Share controls in this UX doc doesn't seem to take the Android OS into account.
yeah, I don't think they fully understand how sharing content works in android
We will 100% need google's blessing on crosswalk before we proceed with it.
I'm pretty concerned about it since I don't have a windows or linux dev machine set up :disappointed: what a pain
We almost ran into trouble on goldmember because of some confusion about the Apache License based on some commented out code.
might just need BSD attribution.
Re: linux, yeah. I hate that i have a virtual box setup with linux in it
i hate when people use the work grock (sp?)

we are probably not going to be able to create custom google now cards until the API supports card types other than events, hotel, flight, and restaurant: <https://developers.google.com/schemas/now/cards>
right. i was looking at that, too
<@U0260V1BX>: its "grok"
<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grok>
I also hate it.
but thats mostly cause I'm not a fan on Heinlein :simple_smile:
:sickymouse:
<@U02F8TTPU>: <@U02618EV1> For the moment, please read up on crosswalk until we get a final answer from google (one way or another)
in particular i think we just need to know how to integrate it into the native code
Roger that.
Will do
<@U02F8TTPU> Would love to pick your brain about setup whenever you're available.
<@U02618EV1> I'll be back in a few and we can get some VMs set up together
Awesome. Thanks!
<@U02618EV1> I downloaded virtualbox and put a copy in /clients/droga5/broadway on the NAS. I just installed it and I'm ready to VM anytime you are.
Awesome. Downloading now. Will be there soon.
just got a hello world crosswalk app to build on OS X and install successfully on my nexus 5, so no need to set up VMs or anything!
following the linux install procedure should do the trick. I already had python and the android sdk installed, just needed to get ant
neat!

however, I installed and followed the tutorial for the Android (ARM + x86) download, and that creates a fullscreen app (no action bar) consisting of a single html page... which is not what we ultimately need. I'm going to try the Android webview (ARM) download because we need to integrate this with native android UI objects
Great!
ok yes, I got the XWalkView working in the app

it's basically just a wrapper for their jars, soooo there are the known google acceptance issues, but I can just check this into a repo and you can try it out <@U02618EV1> whenever you're ready... no need to go through all their installation steps, all you need is to follow the Android Studio install path and we can go from there
Sure. Let me try following the Linux installation steps. BRB.

Ok, I added all of my notes into their UX doc. Please feel free to add any more! <@U026PHQ3J> i didnt address any of the taylor swift / where in the globe you are stuff because that stuff seems brainstormy on their end, but if you'd rather I nip it in the bud I am happy to do so. Let me know.
<@U02618EV1> is gaston your bitbucket username?
gastonfig
great... I think I shared the repo with you and <@U026PHQ3J>
I'm heading out for today, but I'll be available if you need anything
Awesome. Still downloading and installing things. Sorry it's taking so long...network is a bit slow.
no worries at all, the network is what it is
I'm planning to go to Node tonight so I'll be online again eventually
<@U02F8TTPU> Finally got it running. Just FYI.
Will at the BB stuff tonight and we can chat tomorrow.
Cool!
